meanings.definition: To press something firmly between two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: She squeezes the toothpaste tube to get the last bit out.
meanings.sent2: He always squeezes the sponge before using it to clean.
meanings.sent3: The chef squeezes the lemon, adding a burst of flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent4: Time squeezes us all, urging us to make the most of each moment.
meanings.sent5: The hug squeezes out all the worries, leaving only warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: A situation in which there is not enough space.
meanings.sent1: The tiny car barely fits in the parking spot due to the tight squeezes.
meanings.sent2: In the crowded elevator, she felt the uncomfortable squeezes from all sides.
meanings.sent3: The closet was so full of clothes that finding anything was like a game of squeezes.
meanings.sent4: The city's narrow streets create squeezes for both pedestrians and vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The small room felt even smaller with all the furniture, creating squeezes for movement.

meanings.definition: A small amount of liquid that comes out of something when it is pressed.
meanings.sent1: The ketchup bottle always leaves a messy squeeze on the table.
meanings.sent2: When she cut the orange, a juicy squeeze dripped onto the cutting board.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chews the toy, causing a squeaky squeeze to escape.
meanings.sent4: The burst of flavor in the soup comes from a fresh lemon squeeze.
meanings.sent5: The refreshing drink is incomplete without a squeeze of lime for that zesty kick.
